skill.name: pathml
skill.description: Computational pathology toolkit for analyzing whole-slide images (WSI) and multiparametric imaging data. Use this skill when working with histopathology slides, H&E stained images, multiplex immunofluorescence (CODEX, Vectra), spatial proteomics, nucleus detection/segmentation, tissue graph construction, or training ML models on pathology data. Supports 160+ slide formats including Aperio SVS, NDPI, DICOM, OME-TIFF for digital pathology workflows.
skill.summary: Computational pathology toolkit for analyzing whole-slide images (WSI) and multiparametric imaging d...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No executable code or tooling is present, only documentation and example workflows. No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were detected.

content.value_statement: Whole slide pathology images are large and complex to analyze reliably. This skill guides PathML workflows for loading, preprocessing, modeling, and spatial analysis.
actual_capabilities: Explain loading 160+ WSI formats with SlideData and specialized slide classes
Design preprocessing pipelines with stain normalization, tissue, and nucleus detection
Construct spatial cell and tissue graphs with multiple connectivity methods
Guide HoVer-Net and HACTNet training, evaluation, and inference workflows
Describe HDF5 storage, tile generation, stitching, and caching strategies
Outline multiplex imaging workflows for CODEX and Vectra with marker quantification
limitations: Does not execute PathML or run code in your environment
Requires PathML and dependencies installed locally
Remote segmentation relies on external DeepCell services if used
Performance guidance depends on available CPU or GPU resources

use_cases.title: Analyze H&E slides
use_cases.description: Build a preprocessing pipeline and segment nuclei for morphologic studies on whole slide images.

use_cases.title: Quantify multiplex markers
use_cases.description: Process CODEX or Vectra data, segment cells, and quantify marker expression for spatial profiling.

use_cases.title: Train nucleus models
use_cases.description: Prepare PathML datasets and train HoVer-Net or HACTNet with evaluation metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Load a slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to load an SVS slide with SlideData, generate tiles, and read a region for quick inspection.

prompt_templates.title: Build preprocessing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PathML pipeline for tissue detection, stain normalization, and nucleus detection with reasonable parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Graph workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to build a cell graph from a segmentation mask and add morphology and intensity features.

prompt_templates.title: Train HoVer-Net
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a HoVer-Net training workflow with dataset setup, loss components, and evaluation metrics.

output_examples.input: Give me a basic pipeline for H&E preprocessing and nucleus detection.
output: Load the slide and generate tiles at your chosen pyramid level
Run tissue detection before stain normalization to improve accuracy
Apply nucleus detection and store masks for downstream analysis

best_practices: Validate preprocessing on a small set of slides before batch runs
Use tissue masks when performing stain normalization
Save processed data to HDF5 for reproducibility and reuse
anti_patterns: Running heavy pipelines without checking tile quality or artifacts
Mixing slide formats without confirming backend support
Ignoring memory limits when using distributed processing

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides guidance and examples that work across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not execute code or access your datasets. It only provides guidance.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing PathML project?
faq.answer: Yes. You can apply the workflows and code patterns to your project structure.

faq.question: Does it access or upload my data?
faq.answer: No. The content is local guidance and does not transmit data.

faq.question: What if my slide format fails to load?
faq.answer: Check the backend choice and confirm the format is supported by OpenSlide or BioFormats.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic ML guides?
faq.answer: It is pathology specific, with PathML APIs, WSI formats, and domain workflows.
